title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I had an interview with  TAMU's Academic Innovation for an instructional designer position in March this year via Zoom. A position for which I am more than qualified perhaps overqualified. There were two people a director and an employee. The interview was very rigid and structured, not conversational at all. It seemed they were only interested in getting to know the professional and not the person. It felt rehearsed as they both took turns asking questions based on a script they read. I felt it was impersonal. Having worked in HR myself, I find that conversational interviews work best in recruiting talent. Both recruiters spent most of the time looking into their computer monitors and not making eye contact with me, which is crucial in person and even more so in a virtual interview.
At one point and  I was talking and made a grammatical mistake (English is my second language) and I was quick to self-correct and at that moment the director quickly turned her face to see me. At that point, I thought it was unlikely I would get the job, and I was right, so much for inclusion and diversity.  It is unfortunate, TAMU still has staff with this attitude and worse when it is now a Hispanic Serving Institution. These behaviors give TAMU the bad reputation it has struggled so hard to change. I recognize the institution has made a conscious effort to improve in the last decade but, staff needs more training in cultural sensitivity and DEI.
Interview Questions:
What process do you follow to develop a course?
How do you guide faculty in the course design process?

Interview Descriptions: It sounds easy, until you’re the one in the hot seat trying to decide which project to pick. Even if you’ve prepared talking points about your most impressive accomplishment ahead of time, you might’ve chosen the wrong one. In my experience, most people’s first instinct is to pick the project or achievement that sounds the most substantial on paper–but that’s not always the one that illustrates their actual technical ability.
Interview Questions:
Can you tell me a little about yourself?
Why do you want this job

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position available at the Center of International Business Studies through Workday. A week later, I received a phone call from the program coordinator asking to meet for an in-person interview the following week.

I arrived about 15 min early to the interview—which they were extremely grateful for. I was interviewed by the program coordinator and the business coordinator. They took turns asking me their questions (there were around 13-14 questions), gave me time to fully respond to each, and they wrote down my responses. They were very kind and frequently gave me nods and smiles of assurance throughout the interview. The entire interview took about 30 minutes.

A week later I received a call again from the program coordinator offering me the job!

Overall, it was a very easy and quick interview process.
Interview Questions: What programs do you have experience in and what is your level of expertise in each?

Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very easy! The interview was very simple and was conducted in a group setting. They then paid for me to get my CDL so I could begin driving busses right away
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to interact with a customer

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Houston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: was not hard at all,i was asked why the company, what it was that tricked me about the company and what I would love to get.it was not a bad experience i really appreaciated the timew and effort that was put into it.
Interview Questions: why the organization

title: Zone Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not rigorous at all and very straight to the point. it consisted of two interviewers asking me various questions and that made it less tensed because it was not a panel
Interview Questions: past achievements

title: Student Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and it took a week for them to respond with a possible interview. They gave a choice of phone or skype interview, and so I chose a phone interview. Came onto campus for an in person interview. Process was relatively quick and took 2 weeks to finalize.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview and hiring process was quick and straight forward. Background check included. Interviewed with main IT director, then the director of the department applied to. Between 2 interviews, the whole process took maybe 2 weeks until my first day
Interview Questions: What's your biggest weakness?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick, I emailed the professor, interviewed, and had the job within 2 weeks. It might depend on the professor that you will be working with. Your experience is totally dependent on your professor, so take my positive experience with a grain of salt.
Interview Questions: Discussed previous work experience, why I would be a great candidate, spoke about how I was prepared to assist students and was quizzed on my knowledge of the subject matter.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief and kind of cary, but overall, it was a great experience. It is such a large complex that there is plenty of opportunity to move around and grow. Overall, I would suggest going through the application process and being honest/true to your experiences.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. The people conducting the interview did not introduce themselves to me. One person began reading questions like a robot, and would reply with "Good" when I finished answering before reading the next question. They seemed over-worked and uninterested in interviewing me, which was frustrating because I was invited to interview and spent time preparing.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to our teaching?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an one-on-one meeting in about 15 minutes. Very easy and no pressure at all. Talk about my background and skills and what expected to learn from this position.
Interview Questions: Are you highly proficient in MATLAB?

title: Veterinary Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I came and spoke with my Director, then we met with about 5 other people that were not even associated with this department and then I was hired.  I did not understand why we met with the other people until after I was hired and that Director was retired and another hired.  That group was closely associated with our group and we work closely together.  The Director that retired was getting ready to leave and was not very helpful or communicative in the entire process.  Once he retired, shortly after I was hired, the new Director and I learned what was supposed to go on and how to get things accomplished together.  I now understand the workings of the departments, but in the beginning, I was very confused.
Interview Questions: They asked about former experience in the field.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the jobs for aggies website. I got a call with two days. The interview went well, I was asked simple questions, mostly technical. It was good overall
Interview Questions: Tell me your expertize in Biotech field

title: Assistant Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called me to schedule an interview and once there they asked me a few questions and showed me their work. After this they were very quick to offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Q: How familiar are you with the adobe programs? Which one are you more comfortable with? and do you know how to use InDesign?

title: Event Services Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had to apply on the Rec Sports website and email it in or drop it off at the Rec Center. I waited for an interview time. I was interviewed by students and answers some questions. The interview was around 20 minutes long.
Interview Questions: What year are you in?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contact professor who incharged and discuss the teaching assistant job detail. Since the course I teach is directly related to my study, it's not hard to get it. However, TA opportunity is not much so get the job information as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: Willing to complete TA training? Attend TA weekly meeting? Prepare for lecture?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Talk to Faculty. They will ask and know how good you are technically in the field. They will also want to know why you are in and help you to accomplish your goal all along the way. Don't worry about your knowledge or skill set. They will shape you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join?

title: Student Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Two interview rounds that included a campus interview and presentation. First round was a 30 minute phone interview. Second round was a day long campus interview. They use a quantitative scoring system rather than a three-scale recommend or not recommend evaluation form for interviewers. Flight and lodging were taken care of and meals are provided for the campus interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you delivered difficult feedback.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The board will  begin asking you a series of questions to assess your knowledge, abilities and personal suitability. These include:

Closed questions that demonstrate your knowledge by requiring a specific factual answer.
Open-ended questions that are broader in scope and require you to work through the answer.
Situational questions that describe a hypothetical situation and ask how you would proceed in those circumstances.
Behavioural questions that ask you to describe a time in your own history when you dealt with a certain situation, and to explain how you dealt with it.
Interview Questions: Behavioural questions that ask you to describe a time in your own history when you dealt with a certain situation, and to explain how you dealt with it.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was really straight-forward. They asked me about my resume and made me elaborate on each of my past experiences. They talked to me specifically about my leadership role and how I communicate with people.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had conflict with someone.

title: Project Management Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with two different people. Supervisor and Manager. Supervisor asked many questions about skills and background. Tried to gain insight on how detail oriented I was.  How knowledgeable I was on certain software.
Interview Questions: What are two weaknesses.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: I completed my application online. The application required a resume, cover letter, and supplement questions. It took about 2 to 3 hours to complete the entire online application including the supplement questions. It took about 2 weeks to receive an update about my application. I did not get moved on to the next round of the application process. Overall the application process was self explanatory and if another job at Texas A&M open up, I would apply for it.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience managing volunteers or staff?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: You are given some literature which you are asked to read and analyze and answer a series of questions which is the first stage. Second stage is a an in person interview where you are asked another series of questions related to how you work in groups, time management skills. You are emailed offer/decline letter about a week after
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time and balance undergraduate work?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: A very welcoming environment from the very beginning. The supervisors get to know you and end off with questions about what you know how to do and what you are willing to learn.
Interview Questions: Are you open to learning more about the Adobe Creative Suite?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back and easy going. Went in applied and received a call within a few weeks and after the interview, I was hired. It was a one on one interview with the supervisor around the facilities.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience?

title: IT Governance Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1) phone interview
2) 5 man panel interview of 33 canned HR approved questions
Some questions were redundant or superseded by previous answers.
The panel members were HR, Customer CIO and infrastructure technology team leaders.
Apparently the Customer CIO needed help yesterday in getting regulatory compliance in place.
Interview Questions:
IT technical experience
IT quality measures
Leadership experience (best/worst), from me/to me
Communication style(s): Executives, peers/colleagues, employees, clients
Anecdotal best/worst job/situation/solution

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the most simple and easy interview that I had ever gone through. You will walk into the office and wait for several other applicants to show up and then the managers will take you into a large room where they present the job specifications, policies and operations to you. They will then ask a random question that will decide the order of the 1-on-1 interviews. Dress business casual (the other folks that interviewed with me did not get the job, but they were in very casual attire). Be nice and courteous to the interviewer and get to know them personally. I got a job offer by the end of the 10 minute 1-on-1 interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Vehicle Maintenance Dental Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was in the back office. You sit down and talk to flora about your communication skills and how good of a self starter you are. It is pretty easy and they want you to succeed.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you used communication effectively.

title: Academic Advisor Administrator/Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Simple one on one  interview, asked basic questions about what I was looking for and a bit about myself and why I wanted to work here. Contacted via email, process didn't take too long.
Interview Questions: what are some of your hobbies?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. I just asked the programs coordinator if they were still interviewing and we set up a time. I went in the next day and talked with the programs coordinator about what I thought the office's purpose on campus was and how I would help advance that purpose.
Interview Questions: What do you feel should be the role of this office on campus?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and just basic customer service questions. It just takes some time for them to call you back. One of the downsides is that you have to work one 3rd shift when you start.
Interview Questions: How do you manage while under stress?

title: Front- End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Dallas, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: First we had interview over skype after few days, the second interview was held face-to-face to discuss more about the position and the opportunity of the work. The decision is still pending as on June,2016
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself in after 3-5 years

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Spent time in the lab answering questions about problem solving, was questioned about previous related research experience, asked about different types of relaeant classes I took, Was asked what my last meal would be
Interview Questions: How do you approach impossible situations?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It really wasn't much of an interview, just asking for availability. There were two interviewers and it lasted less than five minutes. It was the easiest interview! Got the job!
Interview Questions: What hours are you available?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very long hiring process. From the day I submitted my application to me starting was basically half the semester. The interview itself was not bad though. They just want to get to know you and how good you would be at the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you didn't know how to answer someones question?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Just directly apply online and submit all the documents needed. The key point is about GPA and academic achievements, especially research proceedings. If you have one or even better two papers under the belt, I think you'll really competitive in the application process.

The communicating skills are also very important here based on the industry-driven nature in the chemical engineering department. You know your stuff and you communicate in a concise and comprehensive way. Professors will like you.
Interview Questions: My GPA and my GRE Math.

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. Received a tour of the lab, met some current employees while passing through the lab, was given the run-down of day to day responsibilities there, told that the work environment was very family-minded.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your major and how it makes you competitive for this position.

title: Extension Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Houston, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief and Interviewer kept looking at wristwatch from the get go. He kept on sighing out loud. Looked around the room and made it obvious he didn't want to be there.
Interview Questions: How many children do you have and how old are they were.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Basically you email a PI first and go through the recruitment process, which includes an interview by the committee members, and then the committee members will have a discussion about the interview to have the final decision
Interview Questions: What did you do before

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Laredo, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: there was only one round with the professor who was also my manager, he asked me my experience and how do i learn new things without any guidance.The team leader asked me about my experience and basic linux and python questions, then he asked me to wait for the professor interview, He did not asked any technical questions, he asked situational questions.
Interview Questions: 1) Lets say, you are having an issue and no one is available , how would you handle the situation?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The direct application followed by in-person interview. I was invited to present my work and was asked to submit my academic transcripts. The PI interviewed me on basic biology knowledge and current projects experiences.
Interview Questions: what is your past molecular biology experience in the lab?

title: Territory Development Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Houston, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began as a series of phone interviews and then a day-long interview at the Alert Logic office in Houston. Their were approximately 44 applicants present. We were asked to do group presentations (a total of 3) and gave a 3 minute presentation alone to the company. Afterwards we waited for the hiring results for an hour. Only 8 people were hired.
Interview Questions: Would you say you're competitive?

title: Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by a large committee made up of the local stakeholders, the district administrator, and the state coordinator. Standard questions and questions related to the job were asked. It was a fairly relaxed and friendly atmosphere, like they wanted you to do your best and have a good time.
Interview Questions: What is your experience dealing with the public?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
For international person,
They required me to proof the level of English speaking.
It was Comfortable.
They make me relax and comfortable
It was a nice time to know about that department.
But the process take some time(maybe due to the holidays in december)
Interview Questions: What's your major?

title: Technical Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The actual interview was fine, the professors and HR were very nice. When I was offered the job, the starting salary was very low (the same I'm currently making working in a lab, where as this job would be to run and manage a couple labs), so I did my research and counter offered with a more reasonable salary for that job title/description (still thousands less than the Texas average). They came back with a higher offer, but still relatively low. I gave them a final counter offer of only $800 more to accept the job, and they decided to resend my offer completely. I was disappointed in A&M that they expect someone to manage labs for so little, and not value the employee more.
Interview Questions: If I was able to manage ordering, inventory and setting up different labs for the undergraduates.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with professor. Just emailed the professor for an appointment and then met him in person and had a brief discussion about the project and my background. Got the offer letter then and there.
Interview Questions: Asked about background

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: You need to go and talk with professors directly. Introduce yourself and demonstrate them your qualifications and hard work. It would be helpful if you have another professor recommend you.
Interview Questions: What did you know about this project and field?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: It's a two part interview process. If you do well on the group interview then you'll get to do an individual interview. It's not hard at all. Just be yourself and you'll be fine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Just applied on jobsforaggies. Pretty easy overall. Got a call a few days later. They showed me around the lab. I told them i was comfortable with the process. They liked me. I liked them.
Interview Questions: are you a graduate student

title: Graduate Assistant - Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: I came from another institution along with my supervisor, so I didn't take any formal interview. I guess for graduate assistant, interview with your supervisor is the most important part. Also, to meet your department's requirements.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in this lab?

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was based on my portfolio. I was asked to mail all my work and the work that was published. I had also mentioned my social networks to show my work,
Interview Questions: How long have I been working?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was really Simple. Just went to the office of the professors and talked about the projects. Normally the professors in the department of Electrical Engineering ask you to work for free for one-two semesters.
Interview Questions: The professor asked my background in cleanroom technology and my writing experience. Then he told me he would not be able to support me for the first year, but after that, I will have funding for the next three years.

title: Logistics Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I had filled in an application for the job and was called for an interview two weeks after applying. The supervisor was a really humble guy and conversation was very relaxed. I was called for a phone interview and asked about my availability(How soon can I start)
Basic interview questions-behavioral. Talking about previous work experience and how I will deal with a conflict and how I went about solving a problem.
Interview Questions: How would I deal with a conflict with a co-worker

title: Web Develop for Rec Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: They asked how many projects have I done, what are them. Tested my skills in HTML, CSS and so on. Quite easy questions. Asked me about some frameworks, such like ruby on rails and Django. Asked me how many hours can I work one week and how many months can I work.
Interview Questions: What project have I done.

title: Data Entry Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. I was referred by a friend and due to a high need for workers I simply emailed the assistant director and was hired on the spot. There was a phone "interview" but the only real question asked was: "are you a reliable worker." My answer was yes.
Interview Questions: Are you a reliable worker

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was an undergraduate student in the department. My interview process was very informal where I basically had to speak to professors to try and find someone with funding opportunities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to continue your PhD?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Dealt with my projects and past course work and work experience. Got an A in the course, so it was easy to get the position. also had previous experience as a TA which helped too.
Interview Questions: OP-amp basics

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Bryan, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Getting to know me and my hobbies, my past experience with technology, and my organization preferences. I was asked if I had any interest in going into the field of nursing, and if I would submit to a background check.
Interview Questions: How do you organize files on your computer?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the instructor of the class and she gave us a good overview of what the class curriculum was going to be and thus what we'd be expected to review and grade.  Deadlines were discussed as well.  The flow was pretty smooth and I never felt the work load was confusing or unbearable.
Interview Questions: Was this our first time as a TA, and what classes were we taking.  She wanted to know what our majors were and thus get a good overview of us as students.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very fast process. I applied online where student positions are posted and was emailed back within a week of applying. I started the job about 2 weeks after the initial interview. The interview was between myself, and two researchers who run the research facility on the Texas A&M campus where I was hired.
Interview Questions: Can you work nights?

title: Student Worker IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went to the office and have one discussion with the student programmer there. He asked me several  problems in JavaScript inheritance and how I encrypt password in database. He talked about how projects were going there and asked me questions regarding my resume. They have a focus on GIS system so they care about whether candidates have projects using maps.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a tricky step you solved in projects

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions: First, had a procedural behavioral interview. Was then asked many questions about the subject I was to take up. I was asked to work out problems on the board and then walk thorough the problems step by step. Then, there was a group interview in which the panelists each asked me separate questions
Interview Questions: Many questions on Laplace Transforms

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic leetcode problems. Every thing was smooth. The interviewer was nice and always guided you when you are stuck. The problems were easy and straight forward. Nice atmosphere when being interviewed. The only downside is that you have to push them to see if you get the offer.
Interview Questions: Write a programming function.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend who was working at this position earlier and I submitted my application through email to the appropriate person. Then I had few email exchange with HR and they called me for interview in like 10 days. There was only interview. The professor and HR were in the room. They first explained me about the work.
Interview Questions: They asked my about my skills that were needed for this job (like Mysql,MS Access,Excel). HOw comfortable I am working with these technologies and for how long have I worked using it in past.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: The Professor set up the meeting. And interview is very simple, just ask about your experience in research, motivation and plan for the future. The next week is offer. The payment is low, but is very helpful for graduate students.
Interview Questions: What did you do in school. why you want to come here, do you have research plan

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They ask a series of predetermined question, usually with 3 board members in a conference room. Each member will take turns asking a question, and each have to fill out a questionnaire. It's very impersonal. After they are done writing, then they'll open up conversation. They'll tell you that they will contact you after they've interviewed other prospects. I never heard anything back, even after a thank you letter. They didn't ask me much about my personality, or in depth questions about my skills.
Interview Questions:
Top 3 Weaknesses and Strengths?
Describe a situation which you had to deal with a conflict?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Kingsville, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straight forward.  They asked me about my experience and my educational background.  I have a Masters Degree in Education.  I had previously worked as an instructor.  They had a couple of positions that they were considering me for.  I took a test in math and chemistry since I would be tutoring math and chemistry.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your educational background.

title: Academic Advisor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a committee over Skype. Only one person on the committee asked questions, the rest took notes. They asked very generic questions about my experience, availability, what I wanted out of the job, etc. The interview took about 40 minutes to complete and roughly a week later I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Bryan, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Marketing Manager first and was then brought in for a team interview. I was then put through a skills test to design an infographic. Overall, it was a great experience. The team was dynamic and I never felt like I was in the hot seat. It was more like a friendly conversation.
Interview Questions: How do you stay abreast of new trends in marketing?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online via email to the program director.

 If this is a position you are interested in, I would suggest contacting the person hiring directly as many times they will pick an individual who contacts them earlier than the application comes out rather than putting out an application. Contact them with  a cover letter and resume. 

I applied when the application came out and emailed the program director my materials as requested. I was contacted in 5 days, interviewed on phone almost immediately, and asked to come in person 5 days later. Found out I was selected 3 days after interview.
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply for this position? 
What do you hope to gain from this position? 
What can you bring to this position? 
What type of manager do you prefer?

title: Writing Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Requirements included an example of a long paper and an essay (as a cover letter), and an interview with the director of the center and some of the team members.
Interview Questions: How would I address a situation where a student is highly frustrated with the language requirements.

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: My friend ended up his work and referred me as the candidate. I emailed my resume to the professor who will interview with me. He scheduled a time with me and asked me some questions about the projects in my resume. Then he told me I get the job and explained what should I do in his lab. The process is quite relaxing and the professor is very nice.
Interview Questions: Talking about the projects in your resume.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Madison, WI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interview rounds through Skype with my direct supervisor. He reviewed my credentials and published papers after the first round, then get back about one month later with other questions related to my skills. I had to write some summary of my skills.
Interview Questions: Just normal and conventional questions (not competency-based questions).

title: Residence Hall Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic about me questions and then there was a mock interview portion. This part required you to talk about a mock room they have and then answer the interviewers questions. Basically, you need to be sure of yourself and fake an answer even if you have no experience.
Interview Questions: Give us a tour of this room

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: the director will interview each candidate during the campus visit; the director will ask about your past academic experience, your research focuses, why you are pursuing a phd degree, what's your future career goal.
Interview Questions: why are you pursuing a phd degree

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview where you will be evaluated by current Resident Advisors and a Community Director, then from there if you are approved, you will have an individual interview with a current RA and either a GHD or CD
Interview Questions: If you had a budget of $5, what kind of program would you put on?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief introductory call followed by an in-person interview with the direct manager and managers supervisor. Casual environment and nothing too high level in terms of IT questions. The 1:1 interview lasted roughly 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Group Policy, Active Directory and Domain networks?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Do a technical presentation, answer questions and I was asked about what I expect from this specific position what is my career goal, etc. Ask questions about the position. It is very standard procedure for hiring a postdoc.
Interview Questions: Research experience

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very hands-on and friendly. I was interviewed by 2 people in the department and I enjoyed it. They interacted with me and when I was stuck on a question, they gave me an example of themselves before giving it back to me to answer.
Interview Questions: What do yo think your strengths are?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: A classmate of mine had a student worker position and helped me apply and get an interview. Very casual interview process. I emailed the manager, who CC'd another staff member with my information asking to set up an interview. I called him, scheduled an interview, and met with him in their office. After the brief Q&A was over, he talked to me about my class scheduling and hours I could work and told me I had the position if I wanted it. There was some campus-wide employee training materials to go through after that, but the hiring process was very casual; not stressful at all.
Interview Questions: Asked various questions about basic networking protocols and coding experience.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just asked a few questions about my self, my degree, my travel experience, my work experience. Why was I interested in the job. Told me the salary and then introduced me to people. They told me like 50 names which wasn't super helpful and then when I met the people again when I started working, if I asked the secretary what their names were, she'd be like "we've already introduced you, don't you remember?"
Interview Questions: Why are you majoring in your degree?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I was contacted to have an interview. It was a one on one interview with the supervisor and it was straightforward and easy. It was a very casual experience and I received an offer at the conclusion of the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to communicate in the workplace.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was quick and fairly casual. I was interviewed in a conference room by two of my potential supervisors. I was there for ten minutes at most. I was asked questions based off of my resume, and some general personality inquiries.
Interview Questions: I notice that this job doesn't necessarily pertain to your major; why are you interested in pursuing this line of work?

title: Lead Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Bryan, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Came in and met 1 on 1 with my manager.  She was nice enough at first but soon began to ask me very personal questions. It was not until later that I was advised that this was wrong but it's beyond the EEOC guidelines so there is nothing to do now.
Interview Questions:
How much do I currently make?
Where do I see myself in 5 years?
Am I married?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief conversation over the phone with the Professor. Then I had to submit documents and background check before I was officially hired.  Then there are trainings that every employee has to complete by their first week or so before they can do actual work.
Interview Questions: What type of law are you interested in?

title: Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Because this was my first formal interview, I did a lot of homework. I checked through the possible interview questions and prepared answers, while also researching the company’s background. I found the WikiJob website was quite useful for me during my preparation.  It took me a whole day to prepare myself. Even so, my voice was still shaking when the interview began. “Tell me about yourself in one minute. Give me an example of yourself as a team leader.” I answered these questions without hesitation because I already had them on my cheat sheet. Then the interviewer asked, “Why do you feel you'd be good at this position?”

Following this, I was taken on a tour of the facilities.
Interview Questions: If you saw a student cheating, what would you do?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions:
very easy, mainly on advisor. Talk about wether I interested in it. I said yes and talked about  
wether I have former experince. Then I got accepted. Basically very easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Development Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Round 1 was a phone interview. Then I was brought to campus for an all day interview. I met with several stakeholders including staff, the Dean of Students, and some of the students I would be working with. I had to give a 30 minute presentation.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position. Tell me about yourself. Strengths and weaknesses. Student advising experience. Nothing that was that new or A-typical.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was short and the questions were specific. 
Most of the questions were related to past research experience.
Went through past research publications and transcripts.
The whole process lasted around 30 minutes.
Had to wait for a while after the interview.
Interview Questions: Past research experience

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Benefits slowly being taken away, including University days off so family time is less and less. Annual leave is in question, certain university leaders would like to see this reduced for staff. Health benefits have been reduced. People in the creative field such as graphic designers are not appreciated and compared to secretaries and often graphic design jobs are given to secretaries and graphic design positions are reduced.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Just need to get a good professor who can fund you throughout your research. Make sure to get a funding from a same field that your academic interests resides
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first asked to respond to a fake customer ticket, responding and providing an answer to the best of my knowledge. This exhibited my customer service skills. I was then interviewed over the phone, and was asked to walk my interviewer through the process of making a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. This was to test my customer service skills further, examining my ability to clearly and concisely articulate the steps to reach a goal or solution. Lastly, I was brought in for an in person interview, which was fairly informal and personal, highlighting some personal skills that may help me succeed in the position.
Interview Questions: Can you walk me through how to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just send a mail to the head of the hiring teaching assistant, there was no interview question, well thats about it. Nothing unexpected and you know just something really easy
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Used the internal jobforaggies application through Texas A&M to apply and was contacted at the beginning of the school year. A brief, informal interview with the supervisor was set up after emailing my interest in the job and I felt comfortable and encouraged to speak about myself and my qualifications. Within the next week, I was hired and started work a week before university started.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your studies and habits?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Commerce, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Submit application form (Application-Resume-Previous experience letters) -forms will be filtered and candidate will be selected accordingly.
candidates are called again for the 1:1 interview.
The decision will be taken by the HOD of the department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews, one with the local team and then another with a larger portion of the instruction technology services team. During the first interview, they asked me questions about my work history, personality, and a few questions regarding my status as a student. They asked me to complete a small writing sample after the first interview and reviewed it during the second interview. The second interview was much more technical, dealing with the review of my writing sample and technical writing ability as a whole.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about technical writing?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Got back to me quickly and was a great interview. Interview as quick and painless. They just wanted to know that I was trustworthy and hard working. Everyone in the office was very encouraging.
Interview Questions: Can you handle that some animals treated here do not always make it, though we do our best at all times?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Just applied using jobs for aggies, they called me within the week and asked for an interview. I went into the office, was pretty lax atmosphere. Had the direct supervisor as well as their supervisor interview me generic customer service questions. Nothing too difficult
Interview Questions: What did you do when you told someone the wrong information

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The job opening was posted on "Jobs for Aggies". I submitted an application and was called for an interview within a month. The interview consisted of a lengthy meeting with the professor (principal investigator) and a post doctoral fellow.
Interview Questions: My knowledge of microbiology

title: Graduate Assistant - Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: lengthy interview process, had a telephonic phone conversation, lot of responsibilities to handle, multitasking with class projects and exams ! The interview process is very subjective to the professor under whom you want to work. Lot of  opportunities to learn and handle multiple  projects, project management skills also required !
Interview Questions: what did you do as part of your creativity in your job ?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: General interview questions, a few behavioral questions and some situational questions. Very conversational, there were two staff members that interviewed me, they were both very nice. We basically just had a conversation and alternated asking questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle x situation?

title: IT Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Corpus Christi, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It did take them a long time to respond to my application, and the training process was long but they were friendly and enthusiastic. They were very impressed with my previous experience in the IT field and with customer service. Two supervisors were present and I felt very at ease with them. They explained the job and expectations clearly. I don't really remember much more as it was over two and a half years ago. I did work for the university in other positions before and after the year I was at the IT help desk. The previous interview was rather spontaneous as I was interviewed as soon as I saw the table and applied.
Interview Questions: How would I handle upset callers?

title: Student Worker II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Try and get an interview as soon as possible, because processing times take almost a whole semester. The best way to get in is if you already know someone that works there (a recommendation).
Interview Questions: How do you relax?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions:
Posted job in hire aggies
Got a call from the supervisor
Scheduled time for interview
The interview had a few behavioral questions, but most of it had to do with the position that I was applying. The position was at a machine shop in an engineering building, so it required physical activities.
Interview Questions: If I can lift more than 50 pounds

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate (Fellow) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Go over the CV ask me questions related to my CV. Also, I was asked to do a presentation for what I have done so far . Asking me if I am willing to stay more than one year.  the interview was straightforward and went do sooth. Be prepared and confident and everything will be great.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Multimedia Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short and simple. Interview lasted about 15 minutes, mostly surface level questions but there were some technical questions seeing that this is a "technical" job. The entire office sat in on the interview but there's not very many people in the office so it wasn't intimidating or anything.
Interview Questions: Do you have graphic design experience?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: This was an informal interview.  I met with advisor and  viewed labs.  I was granted the position on my prerequisites and recommendation of previous employer. This was an informal interview.  I met with advisor and  viewed labs.  I was granted the position on my prerequisites and recommendation of previous employer.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Student Worker Reed Arena Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview. Questions were simple to respond and nothing out of the ordinary. Try to be as friendly and outgoing as possible and demonstrate your reliability. If the employer can recognize that you are a positive hard working student there should be no issues with the interview. Above all else express any customer service skills you may have, as they are crucial to this job.
Interview Questions: Can we rely on you to never be late? We sometimes have to be up very early and it is very crucial on some days to be right on time.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application with your resume and class schedule attached. They call to make an interview time (not everyone receives a call), and you interview with one full time staff personal and two student leads. They ask you multiple questions and call you again if you have received the job.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest strengths?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short, brief, and casual. It was a 2 on 1 interview. It was hard to figure out where to go to get interviewed, but otherwise it was extremely casual. They just want to get to know you.
Interview Questions: Name three traits you would use to describe yourself.

title: Extension Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Schertz, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of three people at the interview. It was comfortable environment where you did not feel pressured. Took roughly thirty minutes or more. The staff was very friendly and inviting.
Interview Questions: Comfortable driving far distances throughout most of the work week

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Face to face. Sit down. Basic questions. What are your strengths, weaknesses. Can you answer phones, do clerical work, etc. There were over 10 students interviewed and I got hired mainly for my management experience. Make sure you assert that you're responsible.
Interview Questions: What was your management experience like?

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then an in-person interview with my direct supervisor. The phone interview went over the basics and for the in-person interview I brought my portfolio.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with Industry standard design software

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was very good and very professional, and the questions were mainly about the previous research experience, it is much better to have a clear vision of your future research
Interview Questions: research experience

title: Southside Commons Help Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: Apply a week before a new semester begins. That's when the hiring happens. If you are genuine and willing to work crazy hours then you have a good chance.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: They asked me what is my experience of running FEA. And asked some detailed things in ANSYS and ABAQUS which are normally used in commercial software.
Interview Questions: How to bond the nodes in ansys?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview took less than a hour and interviewers were very nice. Easy process, asked easy questions.  Just be confident and you will be good to go. A&M is the best school to work for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submited Work Portfolio of projects completed in my undergrad degree. Received an email for a Skype interview. Went to Texas A&M to visit and met with the employers again in person for information on the project I would be working on. Received a letter of acceptance.
Interview Questions: Previous experience. What can I bring to the table that's new?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: contacted professor, met in person, worked for a month on trial basis, got assitantship
Interview Questions: why you want to join

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: No process, I was approached by a professor due to my interest and attentiveness in class.
Interview Questions: Would you consider a position doing research part time?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: You first get interviewed by three people that currently work there. The interview is very laid back, and only takes about fifteen minutes. If you are selected for a second interview, you attend a social to see how you interact with others in a casual environment. If the employers that are at the social feel like you would be a good fit for the organization, you receive an email that night telling you that you got the job.
Interview Questions: What has been your biggest accomplishment so far in your life?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First: One-on-one interview. 
Very basic questions: tell me about yourself, why are you the best candidate, tell me about a time you excelled at a task, explain your involvement, description of job, availability, do you have any questions, etc.
Second: Four office staff interviewed me at once
Asked the same questions as first interview followed by more descriptions of the job, availability, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: 4-H Youth Development Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: There were several people in the room asking questions, but they were very friendly. It was a very comfortable interview process and I thought that they were being fair and equitable. They asked what my strengths and weaknesses are and they appreciated high grades, but people skills and leadership skills were of course more important.
Interview Questions: They asked if I felt ready to lead and reconcile different groups if there was a conflict or a difference of opinion.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions:
Hired by recommendation to the professor searching for assistant. 
I received recommendation first then had Skype interview about my previous research then professor advised me to apply via general doctorate application process. After passing general application I received both university acceptance and job offer.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions, just discussion of my previous research and proposed topic

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. All I had to do was apply online and send a brief essay on my current academic experience as well as why I wanted to be in the program in the first place. In addition to that they collected transcripts. After that it took a few weeks for them to get back to me and tell me that I had gotten in to the program.
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The HR will call you first and your potential supervisor will talk to you about the research interests, past experience and some ideas about current research field. After that, they will call you again to ask your ideas about the project they are going to do, and how would you like to deal with the problems existing in research.
Interview Questions: Ask some technical questions, publications, long term and short term research plan.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended through a student worker at the time. I submitted my resume via email and scheduled my interview on campus after that. It was a very casual interview process, more of a conversation and just getting to know me! I interviewed with the two people who are now my two bosses. They asked me basic questions about my resume, my major, what activities I was involved with, past jobs, volunteer work etc. Basically just went down my resume. After they talked to me they explained to me the position I was doing and the basic job duties I would be doing. I felt good about it, and they called me a couple days later to inform me I got the job.
Interview Questions: What was your role in (blank) organization?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done over skype. It was pretty straight forward although the interview questions didn't really provide me with any insight on what my responsibilities on the job would be. I had to create and impromptu commercial to "sell" a student on the prospect of studying abroad. My questions were answered although the answers provided were "inaccurate" I wish my former boss had been more honest about the demands of the the position i was applying for..
Interview Questions: Create a commercial to highlight your study abroad experience.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of me calling in via skype and answering some character questions. I was allowed to ask my own questions but i don't think that I was given accurate information. For example, I asked about travel requirements and was told <25% which was 100% untrue.
Interview Questions: I was asked to do an impromptu commercial as if I were trying to sell a study abroad opportunity.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Kingsville, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a telephone interview followed by a one-one interview at their campus. The hiring manager went over my resume. There was a friendly lunch meeting, met other faculty members and students. The offer was sent through email in 2 weeks time.
Interview Questions: Technical questions and mostly went over my resume.

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to get the job, but the interview process was pretty smooth. I had known my employer previously, so that helped me in my interview. I communicated with my employer through email, then we set up an in person interview that only took about 30 minutes. It was really helpful hearing her suggestions and expectations for the job.
Interview Questions: How proficient I was in the Adobe 6 suite.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (Bryan, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was detailed... I interviewed with four people, but in the end they hired another person
Interview Questions: What I thought I would be doing in the next five years.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: submit to the head of department
Interview Questions: Just normal question about what classes you took and etc.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: They do an individual and a group interview. It's a lot of stupid activities that you do in groups that you need to show that you can play nice with others and that you know a little about the job. They also LOVE if you seem to be all about (insert rainbows here) "diversity"
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Application, transcript verification, references, interview, sample lesson plan.  Fairly basic application and interview process, but highly selective.  Must have made an A in the course you are applying to SI for.

title: Entry Level Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2011

If you had a successful first interview, you were asked back for the group portion where you had to perform a bunch of "team building" style activities to test your humor, creativity, and ability to work with others. Various upper level student employees participated without our knowledge in order to perceive how applicants act when they think that nobody is directly supervising them. If you did well enough at the group portion, you were hired.

title: Study Abroad Advisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University (College Station, TX) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview lasted less than an hour. I was placed on speakerphone and questioned by a panel of 4 people. Typical interview questions related to the job and my experience.

I was then contacted for a long interview in-person. I sat in a room with a panel of 4 people and again described my experience and answered typical interview questions. I was asked about various topics, such as working with international students, crisis management, database management, creativity, etc. 

Then I had to schedule a time to submit a written response to a given scenario. There was a 30 minute time-limit and I had to pick one of 4 scenarios. The scenarios were typical situations that might be encountered as a study abroad advisor and the objective is to answer in a way that reflects how you would handle the situation in real life.

It took about 20 days from the initial request to interview until the job offer.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. But, of course, after the interview I thought of ways I could have answered some of the questions better had it not been for nerves.

Specifically, we were asked, if we were the hiring team, which, of a list of 10 different applicants described on a provided sheet of paper, would we choose. We were also given a random assortment of items and asked to put together a program for college students in 15 minutes.
